channel.title: How To Get Your Music In Stores
channel.description:
https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/amuse-free-music-distribution/id1160922922?mt=8 amuse.io is a free way to get your music in stores, keep all of your royalties (amuse takes half the cut) and expand your fan base. I hope this helps a lot of you that are trying to be more professional artists.
Keep in mind that you need your music and album cover in DropBox, iCloud Drive, of Google Drive.

item.title: How To Get Your Music In Stores
item.dc:creator: BlaMeese
item.description:
This is kinda where I turn to SoundCloud and the Auxy community. If you want to release to bigger platforms, like Spotify, than ask people here what they think first. Most importantly, YOU need to like it! If it doesn’t feel right don’t feel pressured to post anything.

Read full topic

item.title: How To Get Your Music In Stores
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Side-thought…

As more and more here are getting their stuff on the major platforms, like Spotify, etc…

Make sure your cover artwork is good – and legal (i.e. doesn’t use any imagery you don’t have permission/license to use).

You should be thinking about how your artwork works within your ‘brand’ as a musician.

http://musicconsultant.com/music-marketing/designing-an-album-cover/
http://diymusician.cdbaby.com/musician-tips/make-album-cover-artwork/
https://blog.landr.com/how-to-release-an-album/

 
Oh, and think about adding a bio.

 

Read full topic

item.title: How To Get Your Music In Stores
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
After some recent discussions about various digital music distribution services, I was wondering about the differences between various digital music distribution services, and found this breakdown/comparison from August this year…

Ari's Take

Ari's Take: CD Baby, Tunecore, DistroKid, AWAL, Ditto...Who is the Best Digital...

This is the most comprehensive and accurate digital distribution review comparison piece on the web. By far. I checked. Who is the best digital distributor? Read on…Amuse vs. AWAL vs. CD Baby vs. DistroKid vs. Ditto Music vs. Fresh Tunes vs. Horus...

item.title: How To Get Your Music In Stores
item.dc:creator: anon6476606
item.description:
$0.004 per play on Spotify, which becomes $4 per 1K plays. You’ll get payouts starting at 6 weeks after it’s released to Spotify.

item.source: How To Get Your Music In Stores

item.title: How To Get Your Music In Stores
item.dc:creator: Produk
item.description:
I recently got some of my music onto Spotify, and I just wanted to let everyone know how I did it.

Spotify

Produk

Produk, an artist on Spotify

From a friend, I learned about a distributor called Amuse. They’re an app. They ship out your music all for free, and you get 100% of the pay. I was like, “Why not?” So I submitted Nova. It got approved, and it shipped out a while ago. This service is truly amazing. It’s incredibly simple to use, and it works great. The only issue that I ran into is that I was sharing an artist page with someone else for a while, but I got it cleared up real fast. Amuse’s customer service is amazing.
Hit up their website at amuse.io for more info.
They have an app on the App Store, that’s what you use to upload songs.
Hit up my Spotify if you didn’t see that big link up there.

Read full topic
